message: @natw forked one of my projects in GitHub and helped me sort some things out in a VIM plugin. +1 beer to Nat!
I know that in the past year I have promised beers at PyCon, post them here (to whom) and a quick description!
Oooo, me, me! ;)
@daniellindsley That last one deserves more, so ★★★★★★★★★★★★★★★★★★★★
@jessenoller & @VanL for all the hard (awesome) work.
@jezdez For all the setup.py files as well as just for being awesome.
@daniellindsley If either of them pay for a single drop of booze during the week it will be a travesty.
I actually told Alex Martelli that I would buy him a beer but I doubt this will be possible since he is a Python "celebrity". This makes me sad :(
for reference on the Alex Martelli thing, see: http://stackoverflow.com/questions/3348958/efficient-way-of-setting-logging-across-a-package-module

@alfredodeza What makes you think you can't talk to a "celebrity"? Alex is usually quite happy to talk to anyone with something interesting to say, and one of the points of PyCon is to allow people to freely exchange ideas. I'd be very surprised if he refused the offer of a beer (though clearly Iam not channelling him here).
@holdenweb Well, not exactly thinking he will refuse, but rather, he will be overwhelmed with 1000's of beer offers :)
That's always a possiblity, but I would go for it anyway

@alfredodeza I somehow ended up sitting next to Guido at dinner tonight.  Took a lot of self control to not go total fanboy but it seemed to work out fine.  I think the secret is that we're all real people, whether we have the "celebrity" reputation or not.
@mpimat I ended up taking a leak next to Guido at Europython. I feel so important!
@mpirnat yep, absolutely right. It all depends on the environment I think. If there is a crowd around someone just to talk to him, you can't just go ahead and yell you owe him beer lol :)

@mpirnat I wound up at that same dinner! (I'm the red-headed guy across and to the right of you). It was pretty awesome that I showed up to help out, and wound up at dinner with Guido and all the others. For the record, you didn't go total fanboy ;-) I hope the same can be said of me.
For that matter, @alfredodeza's employer (ShootQ / Pictage) is working on a little event for people interested in jobs with our company. I'll be buying a beer for interested parties :)
@alfredodeza I seem to remember you promising me a beer at some point in the last year...
Beer what?
Anyone wants to buy me a beer I will promise to try and not stop them ...
